name: Jim Davies
content: Jim Davies | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content University of Oxford Department of Computer Science HomeAbout UsPeopleFacultyJim DaviesJim Davies Professor Jim Davies CITPProfessor of Computer Science (Software Engineering)Governing Body Fellow, Kellogg CollegeE: jim.davies@cs.ox.ac.ukT: 44 1865 283521 Room 461, Wolfson Building, Parks Road, Oxford OX1 3QD United Kingdom Themes:Computational Biology and Health InformaticsCompleted Projects:Cancer BioinformaticsSemantic Frameworksmore…InterestsJim directs a programme of advanced, professional education in software engineering, teaching advanced techniques to people working full-time in industry.  He is leading the development of semantics-driven technology for medical research and electronic governance, and a related programme of work into the automatic generation of systems from re-usable models of structure and functionality. BiographyJim studied mathematics at New College, Oxford, joining the Computing Laboratory (now Department of Computer Science) in 1986 for a Masters' and doctorate. After working as a researcher and lecturer in computer science, at Oxford and Reading, he became a lecturer in software engineering at Oxford in 1995. He has led the Software Engineering Programme since 2000, and was made Professor of Software Engineering in 2006.
